items.title: Window grows larger every time it's reopened in Cubase

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
Every time I close then re-open an instance of Surge XT, the size of the window increases.

**Surge XT Version**
Version: Surge XT 1.2.0.cb11acd
Build: 2023-04-10 @ 13:12:17 on 'fv-az238-859/pipeline' with 'MSVC-19.29.30148.0' using JUCE 6.1.6
System: Windows 64-bit VST3 on AMD Ryzen 9 5950X 16-Core Processor            
Host: Steinberg Cubase @ 48.0 kHz / Process block size: 32 samples

Above was copy-pastaed from Surge XT's version info.

Additionally: I'm running Cubase 12 on Windows 10.

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. In Cubase, select an instrument track containing an instance of Surge XT
2. In the inspector on the left-hand side, click 'edit instrument' to re-open the instance of Surge XT
3. Exit the instance, and re-open it, it should be zoomed in larger than last time.
4. Repeat until it covers an area larger than your desktop resolution.

**Expected Behavior:**
I expected the window to be the same size as last time, not bigger.

I'm holding off on the screenshots because... it's the same thing. But bigger. I'm also not sure about the possibility it's just my DAW, I feel like I would've been able to find a previously reported closed issue at least mentioning it. None of my other VST3 plugins exhibit this sort of behavior.

items.title: WaveShaper mode plot

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

items.body:
Hi,

is there any way on WaveShaper to see the shape plot as -1/1 (input) to -1/1 (output) mapping instead of sine (as input) to -1/1 (output)?

Usually on WaveShaper thats the way it visualize the input/output (Fruity WaveShaper for example, or Trasher2 and so on).

Not sure how thats mapping is named, but any way to display it “classic way”? 

Thanks

items.title: Don't send the Audio Latency message to stdout
items.body: Generally we send errors to stdout but the audio latency is more an informational so add an option to not stdout things from reportError and set it true in the processor when we turn on latency. The dialog will still pop up with a don't warn again in the UI once you open it though.

items.title: Surge XT CLAP instances from prior projects not loading in Bitwig 5.0

labels.name: Host Specific
labels.description: Issues related to specific host(s) or host features

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

labels.name: CLAP
labels.description: Issues related to CLAP plugin format

items.body:
Congrats on the recent release!

In Bitwig 5 Beta 2, on Windows 10, on an Intel i7-3770 CPU, I've loaded two different projects previously saved in Bitwig 4.3.10, including tracks created with Surge XT v1.1 (one project) and v1.2.0 (the other project), CLAP version, 64-bit. When I open the projects with Bitwig 5 Beta 2, the instance(s) of Surge won't load properly. Each instance of Surge yields the message, "Could not load plug-in. Could not load initial plug-in state: Couldn't load the plugin state".

Attempting to reload the plug-in doesn't help. The only option is to load a new instance of Surge XT, but this results in losing any Bitwig modulators that were assigned to the existing instance of the synth.

I've also tried reinstalling Surge XT 1.2.0, and that didn't help (although Surge still opens fine in Bitwig 4.3.10).

I've reported this issue to Bitwig tech support as well.

items.title: Use uses_wavetabledata() more consistently
Release checklist for Surge XT 1.3.0

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
Release label: XT 1.3.0
Link to milestone: https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/milestone/32

## Pre Install

- [x] Address all open issues for the milestone
- [x] Update the changelog
- [x] Update the manual
- [x] Make sure the `CMakeLists.txt` version matches the version you are about to install

## Executing the install

- [x] Update the releases-xt/azure-pipelines so we don't get a tag conflict when the release happens even 
      if it is just a bump commit
- [x] Create git markers in the surge repo
  - [x] Unlock your GPG key in case, running `gpg --output x.sig --sign CMakeLists.txt` 
  - [x] Create a branch named `git checkout -b release-xt/1.3.0`
  - [x] Sign a tag with `git tag -s release_xt_1.3.0 -m "Create signed tag"`, 
  - [x] Push both the branch and tag to upstream `git push --atomic upstream-write release-xt/1.3.0 release_xt_1.3.0` 

## Post Install

- [x] Update and announce
   - [x] Update homebrew [doc](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/tree/master/doc) 
   - [x] Update [Winget manifest](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-pkgs) (`wingetcreate update --submit --urls https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/releases-xt/releases/download/1.3.0/surge-xt-win64-1.3.0-setup.exe --version 1.3.0 SurgeSynthTeam.SurgeXT`)
   - [x] Ping luzpaz in https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/issues/7132
   - [x] Post to KvR thread, Facebook, Discord, etc.

items.title: Missing scrollbars in VST3 and CLAP under REAPER

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
When using REAPER (which I'll henceforth capitalize as "Reaper") and attempting to resize Surge beyond single-screen size, you are unable to scroll up/down or left/right to view the entire GUI. Trying to manually shrink/unshrink the window to "trick" the scrollbars into appearing likewise does not work.

**Surge XT Version**
1.1.2

* Version: As previously stated, 1.1.2
* Plugin Type: [VST2, VST3, AU] VST3 and CLAP
* Bitness: [32-bit or 64-bit] 64

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open Reaper
2. Load Surge
3. Change zoom level to something beyond the capabilities of a single screen to show at once
4. See error

**Expected Behavior:**
Scrollbars should appear if the plugin real estate is larger than the available window/screen real estate.

**Screenshots:**
I can post if deemed necessary.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: [e.g. Windows 10] Windows 10
 - Host: [e.g. Bitwig, Logic, Cubase, Reaper] Reaper
 - Version: [e.g. 2.4] Reaper version 6.78

items.title: Add a few more Wavetables
items.body: Taken from Crust

items.title: LFO parameter sliders blinking
items.body:
When we click on another modulation source button, we change `modsource_editor[i] = newsource` and `queue_refresh = true;`. Doing that we cause recreating all sliders. But we also repaint some components that cause repainting the sliders of the modulation source and we have that blinking. To prevent that, I set `needsModUpdate = true;` instead of calling `refresh_mod()` so that 'refresh_mod()' would only cause one repainting. 
Issue: https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/issues/6889

Addresses #6778

Also scope multibuttons are now draggable. Further minor UI layout tweaks. Minor parameter name changes.

TODO: Context menu entries for Trigger Mode and Oscilloscope Mode change the value but don't execute the callback that is set in setOnUpdate(). Not sure why.

items.title: Keytrack behaves differently when mod-mapped via saw LFO

labels.description: Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth

labels.description: Modulation related issues

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
[Modulo.fxp.zip](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/files/11183472/Modulo.fxp.zip)

Load that

Learn that scene A has keytracking assigned to a timbre param, and scene B has the exact same assignment via the stopped saw LFO phase mod-mapping trick.
Thus: expect to hear the same behavior on both scenes.

Play a scale from C4 up to C6 in Scene A
Switch to Scene B and play the same scale again
Ponder why those behave differently
Proft?!!

items.title: MSEG Constant Segments trigger properly
items.body:
MSEG Constant segments have an optimization to skip most of the calculation which is great. But it avoices updating an internal state about triggers meaning a segment would fire a trigger on every sample if exactly constant. Update the evaluation time state to make sure we know we are beyond the trigger.

Closes #6915

items.title: MSEG trigs misfire if segment is flat

labels.name: DSP
labels.description: Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth

labels.name: Modulation
labels.description: Modulation related issues

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.2
milestone.description:
Guess we are doing a 1.2!

~~We want to release 1.1 soon but it will be forever and a day before 2, and we won't do a 1.2, so this is a milestone for stuff we want to do in occasional point releases.~~

items.body:
If an MSEG segment is set up to fire the AEG and/or FEG, and the segment is completely flat, it will fire the trigs at the end of the segment instead of the beginning. 

Confirmed by:
Pinning a few MSEG segments to the top of the screen
set one to fire AEG
make AEG with 0 sustain
assign the MSEG to something inconsequential 
latch. 

Then move the end point of the segment up and down, and pay attention to the timing of the ping. It's tricky to hear in isolation, but you will hear that the ping moves from the start to the end of the segment when it's flat at the top.

Guess we are doing a 1.2!

~~We want to release 1.1 soon but it will be forever and a day before 2, and we won't do a 1.2, so this is a milestone for stuff we want to do in occasional point releases.~~

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
Very minor thing, but when holding Ctrl and dragging **quickly** across the steps in the step sequencer modulator to clear out all the steps in one swipe, it will sometimes leave some steps untouched, meaning you have to go back and clear them afterwards.

Also, when holding down Ctrl and then moving the mouse outside of the bounds of the step sequencer and dragging, it doesn't clear the steps, when in reality it should (just like it does fill the steps if you don't hold down Ctrl).

**Computer Information:**
 - OS: Windows 11
 - Host: FL Studio 21

items.title: Vintage Ladder CPU Spikes with non-simd-length notes in F2 slot after wave shaper

labels.name: DSP
labels.description: Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
Discord user Trace98 reports April 5 in surge bug reports

```
Trace98 — Yesterday at 6:55 PM
Hello, 
-using Vintage Ladder (Type 1 not Type 2) in filter 2, in any configuration where the filter comes after an active waveshaper
using one of the following
 (soft medium hard ojd sine add13 add15 addsqr3 full rect halfpos halfneg sft1fold 1fold 2fold wcfold and from sin+x onward)
causes the cpu to spike up to 100 immediately.
Adding to the weirdness the bug doesn't happen when pressing 3 or more notes simultaneously at the same time;
it only happens when pressing 1 or 2 notes, after the bug manifests adding other ntoes won't fix it.
Sometimes it doesn't happen instantly, it takes a moment or some note ons, but after it happens it stays there
-Reaper v6.78, Win 10,  both CLAP and VST3, latest surge nightly 1.2.nightly.7473f5e (bug happened even in b6c8442)
baconpaul — Yesterday at 7:00 PM
Are you in stereo routing? If you put it in mono routing does the problem resolve with 5 notes?
The vintage ladders are deterministic not iterative so something must be either causing a nan or under flow
(but we have software denormals off)
Trace98 — Yesterday at 7:05 PM
it's a bit weird, i'm testing a bit
by mono routing you mean every routing but wide and l-r right?
baconpaul — Yesterday at 7:06 PM
Yeah like s1 is perfect
Trace98 — Yesterday at 7:08 PM
yeah happens there too
with 1 2 3 5 5 7 notes simultaneously
with 4 or 8 notes it resolves
it's hard to track everything, now when switching between modes the bug persisted. it's very erratic
baconpaul — Yesterday at 7:15 PM
Great can you save your crashing patch as an fxp so I can try it?
```

my theory is that the model is getting an inactive voice in the simd slot (as all models do) but something about the model and un-initialized is making it run away or nan out.

[VintageLadderCPUBug.fxp.zip](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/files/11158754/VintageLadderCPUBug.fxp.zip)

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13387561/230081242-f2ae9a2d-f90c-466f-976c-96b2f5ff5e14.mp4

items.title: Add RMB context menu to main output level meter
items.body:
Contains oscilloscope and CPU usage toggles
Remove CPU usage toggle from main menu
Manual will need to have a section called Level Meter (with #level-meter anchor) -> @Andreya-Autumn just FYI!

items.title: Improve layout of controls in the oscilloscope
Nimbus Effect at very high SampleRates or small Blocks
items.body:
Nimbus at very high sample rates or small blocks would have the internal oversampler mis-align and glitch or in some cases produce silence. I think this fixes it and also adds an assertive regtest.

Addresses #6834

items.body:
Getting audio in the fx chain is pretty easy - you can see how the vocoder does it - but chatting on discord realized that a utility audio in effect you could put in the fx bank with a mix would be useful

so I guess an fx unit with 3 controls

- channel (l,r,stereo,a(on non-a inserts only)
- Audio level db
- Upstream level db

you get the idea - and make sure it doesn’t show up in the fx plugin

items.title: Surge XT presets

labels.name: User Support Request
labels.description: Issues where users are looking for help, not development items

items.body:
Surge XT 1.1.2 running in Reaper v.6.78 in Windows 11. Used to work fine, but now presets not working. In Surge XT VST3i (screenshot attached), presets do not appear to be there. In Surge XT CLAPi, presets appear to load onto midi file (CLAPi - 1), but then defaults every time to same preset (CLAPi - 2). Is installation not working? I have tried reinstalling, and get same problem.
![Surge XT VST3i](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/129475026/229012571-912397e2-711b-4277-b00a-3d4eda7a5c98.jpg)

items.title: User Defaults Issue

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
There seems to be an issue with filesystem access in Surge XT in Windows 10. I have encountered a number of problems:

1. could not create a "Surge XT" folder under C:\users\<me>\Documents
2. could not open SurgeXTUserDefaults.xml for writing when switching skins from the default to Surge Dark
3. Exception occurred while creating category folder when saving any preset. 

**Surge XT Version**

* Version: 1.1.2d3568a9 also NIGHTLY-2023-03-21-06a6c9e
* Plugin Type: CLAP, also standalone
* Bitness: 64 bit

**Reproduction Steps:**

1. install Surge XT from the main website
2. launch Surge XT from the start menu
3. observe the first error, unable to create Surge XT folder in C:\users\<me>\Documents

1. create a Surge XT folder manually (if this is not done, Surge crashes upon selection of the skin)
2. click the menu button and select "Skins...Surge Dark"
3. observe the error "could not open SurgeXTUserDefaults.xml for writing"
4. create a SurgeXTUserDefaults.xml manually
5. close Surge XT
6. reopen Surge XT, notice that the skin is back to the default
7. attempt to change the skin to Surge Dark again, observe the error once more
8. notice that the manually created SurgeXTUserDefaults.xml is still 0 bytes

1. in the main Surge XT window, click "Save"
2. change the category from "Templates" to "abc"
3. leave the name "Init Saw"
4. change Author to "abc"
5. click save, observe the error "Exception occurred while creating category! Most likely, invalid characters were used to name the category..."
6. click ok

**OTHER STEPS**

1. click the patch name to open the patch browser
2. under Functions, click open user patches folder
3. nothing happens
4. click "open factory patches folder" 
5. observe that the factory patches folder opens

**Expected Behavior:**

1. expected user folder to be created
2. expected user defaults file to be created
3. expected to be able to switch skins permanently
4. expected to be able to save user patches
5. expected to be able to open the user patches folder from the patches browser

**Screenshots:**
If applicable, add screenshots/GIF/videos to help explain your problem.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13843226/227028720-926e37c8-9dbe-43fc-a16a-e6fc5953cad9.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13843226/227028772-451b337a-4bf7-4967-b2c7-63a720bcb570.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13843226/227028803-141b25a4-20f1-4794-85f7-68910d62cc2c.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13843226/227028847-9c02347a-c7b1-4e44-8cfd-f202909b8410.png)

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: Windows 10 Home version 22H2 build 19045.2728
 - Host: REAPER, standalone
 - Version: 6.78 win64 rev f121cd

**Additional Information:**
I guess this covers it.

items.title: Weird alias when modulating mixer at Block size 8

labels.name: DSP
labels.description: Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth

labels.name: Modulation
labels.description: Modulation related issues

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.2
milestone.description:
Guess we are doing a 1.2!

~~We want to release 1.1 soon but it will be forever and a day before 2, and we won't do a 1.2, so this is a milestone for stuff we want to do in occasional point releases.~~

items.body:
Build Surge at Block_Size=8, 
Make osc1 a Sine osc (makes it easy to hear the issue)
Attach an LFO to osc1 mixer slider
Play a bass note and bring the LFO rate up.
You'll hear an alias-like ringing that gets louder as LFO rate increases.

Curiously, the frequency of the ringing is constant no matter what note you play, and no matter what the LFO rate is; only its amplitude changes. It seems rooted at around 6k.

And also curiously, if you oversample this block size-8 Surge, the frequency changes as expected (goes to ≈12k at 2x OS etc), but if you use the default block size 32, the problem dissappears from consequential ranges. Introducing some totally overkill treble boost CPU, it does seem like a similar ringing might actually be present also at BS=32, but it's much much quieter. I would've never found it if I wasn't trying to. 

Dropping this in XT2 for now.

Hi, I just found that Surge XT can't play sound if the selected output in settings is "Airpods Pro". There is indeed a sound that is emitted by clicking on the Test button but there is no sound when I strike a key on the virtual keyboard. There is also a message at the top right below Output: "Audio is unavailable". When I change the output and put the MacBook Pro speakers on, the message goes away and everything works fine.

Hi and thanks a lot for your message. Version is Surge XT 1.1.2.d3568a9 for MacOS 64-bit Standalone on Apple M2 Pro. 2. Have the error get dropped/ignored if you dont prompt again by using OK Cancel with Dont in SGE

Closes #6524

items.title: Add an errorType enum; use it to report latency shift.
items.body:
1. Add a SurgeStorage::ErrorType enum which goes with reportError and defaults to GENERAL_ERROR
2. Call reportError with AUDIO_CONFIGURATION from the new resize
3. When we get that in SurgeGUIEditor, do nothing. Oh well! Maybe later we will do something.

Addresses #6524

items.title: Start work on Input with non-block-size blocks
items.body:
Input with block-size-not-multiple-of-BLOCK_SIZE blocks would distort in all platforms. This begins to fix it for the VST3 and AU with the VST3 being most important, since FL does this all the time.

What we do here is: if a block is handed to us with a non-multiple of BLOCK_SIZE we just start lagging the input. We don't turn on latent processing in the synth, we don't do it in the CLAP, and we don't show a user error. Clearly this requires more thought but it will stop randomly distorted and crashing behavior, at least, in the case where you don't have uniform blocks.

Addresses #6524

items.title: Dismiss any active menus in ~SGE
items.body: SurgeGuiEditor destructor dismisses any active menus in case you close by some mechanism. Reaper Ctrl-W with a window open would do this often. Closes #6796

items.title: Add a defensive clamp to airwindows name lookup
items.body:
I think theres a tiny race condition which means a parameter can have an airwindows paramter mapper on a non-airwindows parameter when changing presets while notes are playing, as described in proper rebuild, so XT2, but for now add a bit of defense on range vs the static data structure.

Addresses #6619

Larger font used for sliders, like in the rest of the GUI

Closes #6875

items.title: Ponder LFO EG sustain behavior on modulation

labels.name: Modulation
labels.description: Modulation related issues

labels.name: Breaking Change
labels.description: In order to close this issue we need to make a breaking change (no backwards compatibility)

milestone.title: Surge XT 2.0
milestone.description:
Next level Surge!

This milestone presents a solid book of work we have slated for the next major Surge XT release, after the initial one we have released in Jan 2022.

items.body:
As of 1.2, EG sustain params behave in two ways: 

LFOEG's can not have sustain modulated during the sustain phase. Modulation will be in effect during decay, as the decay approaches the moving target, but once sustain phase begins the value is held as discussed here: https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/858

FEG and AEG can have sustain modulated, also once the sustain phase begins. The modulation is slew-limited by the decay rate parameter though. EvilDragon points out that this is probably congruent with many analog designs (in which decay may quite literally be a slew limiter on sustain value), but I don't know if this is expected behavior in a digital synth like Surge. 

Changes here would be breaking obviously. So for XT2:

A: Decide on what behavior we would really want.
B: Make sure that behavior is consistent across AEG/FEG/LFOEG

items.title: Truncated WT Files no longer add noise
items.body:
Truncated WT files would silently fill the end of the buffer with noise. This was actually a problem for oneshot/Pulse which advertises 3 tables but has 2. Clearly some old semantic where this would have worked is either ignore the last or fill with zero, so replace the fixme which was sitting here with a fill-with-zero. This will also fix
https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge-rack/issues/843 when all merged through.

items.title: Clamp all Twist parameters
Add a decay to the spectrum view
Guard against division by zero opportunities.
items.body: It hasn't happened even when I tried forcing it, but it's worth being a little proactive and making sure it never happens.

items.title: Enable "freeze" parameter for spectrum viewer.
Don't set overlay wrapper to opaque background
items.body: Gives full control to the skin color `editor.overlay.background` regarding opacity

items.title: Adjust init values for Delay and Reverb 1
items.body: ...so that the FX plugin doesn't instantiate with delay at 100% mix :)

items.title: FX Mode handles block mod buffers better
items.body:
In the event we are in non-latent mode and our buffer is not a multiple of block size, then

1: reset the inputs and outputs
2: Enter latent mode
3: set latency and
4: inform the host of a latency change

Addresses #6638 but some testing before we close it would be super.

items.title: Alias Editor Accesibility Tweaks
items.body:
1. The CustomEdit has the right "size" so it works in tab traversal
2. The Menu/Right Bracket callbacks all work
3. Enter on CustomEdit butto activated

Closes #6822

items.title: Accesibility Quantized Arrow Keys with Command
items.body:
1. Make 'Command' the Quantized key consistently in ally and mouse
2. Actually respond to it in the modulatable slider, albeit with a pretty hacky way (see the comment there)
3. Fix a problem with size-one wavetables and quantized drags

Closes #6593

items.title: Stop runaway modulators on extreme changes
items.body:
In extreme (really computer generated) midi sequences you could force the modulator smoother to runaway since in one case it would push you outside of [target,value] when interpolating. Fix that with a clamp; and add an assert in case theres other future problems.

Closes #6835

items.title: Introduce noise floor / dB ceiling parameters for the scope spectrum view.
items.body: Getting close to feature-complete for the spectrum view.

items.title: Half Rate Filter Considerations

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: DSP
labels.description: Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth

labels.name: Breaking Change
labels.description: In order to close this issue we need to make a breaking change (no backwards compatibility)

milestone.title: Surge XT 2.0
milestone.description:
Next level Surge!

This milestone presents a solid book of work we have slated for the next major Surge XT release, after the initial one we have released in Jan 2022.

items.body:
XT1 should definitely be left alone for these considerations due to patch breakage.

a) Half-rate filter quality could be improved by, instead of literally being half of oversampled Nyquist, instead being a max of 22.05KHz (half of Nyquist at a host sample rate of 44.1KHz, and beyond the range of hearing of the great majority of human users). This allows any stopband leakage to be less likely to produce aliasing at higher sample rates (48k, 96k etc). However, this should probably be a toggleable option for those users who sample Surge at high sample rates, expecting harmonics to be present because e.g. they are going to slow down the sample.

b) Voice-level nonlinear filters and waveshapers could be given more headroom by inserting a voice-level half-rate filter right before them. That is, currently even "clean" oscillators (those expected not to alias significantly) produce harmonics up to half of oversampled Nyquist. If instead, there were only silence above the range of human hearing, these otherwise inaudible harmonics couldn't become potentially-audible aliasing after passing through nonlinear operations. Granted, with the clean oscillators these harmonics are already usually quiet due to natural decay of harmonic amplitudes, unless you produce very high notes. This should also be toggleable for the same reasons as in a) (possibly the same toggle option).

c) Not quite half-band related but close enough to be worth mention here: modulation of filter cutoff should probably be clamped similarly to 22.05KHz (this suggestion came from @mkruselj). Unfortunately especially with self-oscillating filters this means a very digital sounding fixed ringing at this max frequency under modulation (like certain unnamed commercial digital synthesizers that have filters that clamp at ~10k), and even though it's beyond the range of human hearing it could produce intermodulation or aliasing that is audible. However, at 44.1KHz a lack of such clamping basically guarantees aliasing in this scenario.

items.title: Preselect sub menus and patch items in PatchSelector
items.body:
We assumed that we needed to remember an ID of an item to preselect, but it might be a constant since we only have one preselected item in each submenu, and it doesn't have to be unique globally. 
https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/issues/6832
